Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro phosphorylation of Akt1 by LRRK2

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant human Akt1 (Histagged protein), recombinant human LRRK2 (GST - tagged protein), bovine myelin basic protein (MBP)
Material used.Description: One hundred nanograms of recombinant human Akt1 (Histagged protein) was incubated with 50 ng of recombinant human LRRK2 [glutathione - S transferase (GST)-tagged protein consisting of amino acid residues 970 - 2527; either wildtype, R1441C mutant, G2019 mutant, or I2020T mutant] in 25 μl of reaction mixture. In some experiment, bovine myelin basic protein (MBP) was used as the substrate of LRRK2.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (autoradiography for 32P - labeled proteins, Western analysis without radiolabeled c - ATP)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for mutants R1441C, G2019S, I2020T in terms of Akt1 phosphorylation compared to wild - type)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: reduced interaction with, and phosphorylation of, Akt1 for mutants R1441C, G2019S, I2020T
Readout description.Result Description: The three LRRK2 mutants (R1441C, G2019S, I2020T) exhibited significantly weaker kinase activity of Akt1 (Ser473)-phosphorylation than the wild - type LRRK2. When MBP was used as substrate, G2019S as well as I2020T mutant LRRK2 exhibited much stronger kinase activity than the wild - type LRRK2.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA was used for statistical comparisons in some related experiments (as shown in figures for comparisons of phosphorylation levels)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro GST pull - down assay

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant GST - LRRK2, GST alone, recombinant His - Akt1, glutathione agarose beads
Material used.Description: Recombinant GST - LRRK2 or GST alone was mixed with the recombinant His - Akt1 and incubated with glutathione agarose beads overnight at 4 °C in 100 μl of TNE buffer.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for mutants R1441C, G2019S, I2020T in terms of Akt1 binding compared to wild - type)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: impaired ability to bind Akt1, particularly in the case of G2019S LRRK2 for mutants R1441C, G2019S, I2020T
Readout description.Result Description: The pull - down assay using the three LRRK2 mutants (R1441C, G2019S, I2020T) showed that the reduced kinase activity toward Akt1 (Ser473) was ascribable to impaired ability to bind Akt1, particularly in the case of G2019S LRRK2.

Material used.Material Source: Proteins after in vitro phosphorylation and cell lysates
Material used.Material Name: Proteins from in vitro phosphorylation reactions, cell lysates from SH - SY5Y cells
Material used.Description: Proteins after in vitro phosphorylation and those in cell lysates were subjected to SDS - PAGE using a 5 - 20% gradient of e - PAGEL, blotted onto polyvinylidene fluoride membrane, and analyzed using various antibodies.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative and Quantitative (protein levels and phosphorylation levels)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for LRRK2 - knockdown cells in terms of Akt1 phosphorylation compared to control)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: diminished phosphorylation of Akt1 (Ser473) in LRRK2 - knockdown cells
Readout description.Result Description: Transfection of LRRK2 - specific RNAi into SH - SY5Y cells reduced the level of LRRK2 protein and resulted in a marked reduction of phospho - Akt1 (Ser473), while the total level of Akt1 protein was not affected. The SH - SY5Y clone overexpressing full - length LRRK2 exhibited higher Akt1 (Ser473) phosphorylation, and knockdown of overexpressed LRRK2 reduced the phosphorylation level of Akt1.

Biological replicates.Description: For experiments with SH - SY5Y cells, n = 3 biological replicates were used for statistical analysis in some cases (as shown in figures)

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA was used for statistical comparisons in some related experiments (as shown in figures for comparisons of protein and phosphorylation levels)

Material used.Material Name: SH - SY5Y cells, Stealth RNAi, V5 - tagged wild - type full - length LRRK2, neomycin gene - expressing SH - SY5Y clone
Material used.Description: For knockdown of endogenous LRRK2 expressed by neuroblastoma SH - SY5Y, cells were transfected with 25 mer of Stealth RNAi. A SH - SH5Y clone stably and uniformly overexpressing the V5 - tagged wild - type full - length LRRK2 and a SH - SY5Y clone expressing only the neomycin gene (vector control) were used.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (protein levels and phosphorylation levels by Western analysis)

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for LRRK2 - knockdown cells in terms of Akt1 phosphorylation compared to control)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: diminished phosphorylation of Akt1 (Ser473) in LRRK2 - knockdown cells
Readout description.Result Description: Transfection of LRRK2 - specific RNAi into the cells reduced the level of LRRK2 protein and led to a marked reduction of phospho - Akt1 (Ser473), while the total level of Akt1 protein was not affected. The phosphorylation level of Akt1 [phospho - Akt1 (Ser473)/total Akt1] in the cells with LRRK2 - knockdown was reduced compared to that in the RNAi control cells.

Biological replicates.Description: For experiments with SH - SY5Y cells, n = 3 biological replicates were used for statistical analysis in some cases (as shown in figures)

Basic negative control.Description: A SH - SY5Y clone expressing only the neomycin gene was used as a vector control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA was used for statistical comparisons in some related experiments (as shown in figures for comparisons of protein and phosphorylation levels)
